$eref.description: Contains an array of points, along with a spatial reference field.
$eref.title: multipointGeometry

___points.description: An array that corresponds to 2D and 3D points.

___hasM.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains M coordinate values.

___spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

___hasZ.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains Z coordinate values.

$eref.description: Defines the JSON formats of the point and spatial reference objects.
$eref.title: pointGeometry

___m.description: M coordinate which contains measures used for linear referencing.

___x.description: X coordinate which is measured along the east/west axis.

___y.description: Y coordinate which is measured along the north/south axis.

___spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

___z.description: Z coordinate which measures height or elevation.

$eref.description: A polygon contains an array of rings and a spatial reference.
$eref.title: polygonGeometry

___hasM.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains M coordinate values.

___rings.description: Represents an array of rings. Each ring is an array of points.

___spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

___hasZ.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains Z coordinate values.

$eref.description: Contains an array of paths and a spatialReference.
$eref.title: polylineGeometry

___hasM.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains M coordinate values.

___spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

___hasZ.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains Z coordinate values.

___paths.description: Three nested array levels describing a polyline. The first level describes individual paths; the second describes the points of these paths; and the third gives the coordinates of the points.

description: Please refer to the links below for objects which define the JSON formats of geometry and spatial reference objects.
title: geometry
